page.title: 05Buildings' Survey
page.content: In the southern sector of Llandrindod the majority of the housing is late Victorian and Edwardian.Originally, these terraced buildings were intended as guest houses for the seasonal visitors to the Spa but nowadays their large size has led to many of them being converted into rented flats. In the vicinity of the Lake,a variety of post-war houses may be found.These comprise semi-detached and detached units and are all owner-occupied. Between the Lake and the Convent there are two recent private housing developments. Both of these consist of a mixture of semi-detached and detached houses with a few bungalows The main village of Howey is a nucleated settlement with a number of older stone dwellings though there is a liberal sprinkling of a variety of housing dating from the late 19Cth to
